CashBack(uint256,address,address,uint256.details: Emitted when an investors withdraw it's funds after an IRO fails

Commit(uint256,address,address,uint256,u.details: Emitted when a new Commit is made to an IRO

CreateIRO(uint256,address,address,uint64.details: Emitted when a new IRO is created

FundsWithdrawn(uint256,address,uint256,u.details: Emitted when funds from an IRO are withdrawn

RealEstateCreated(uint256,uint256).details: Emitted when a new real estate token ID is created

SetBaseCurrency(address,address).details: Emitted when a new currency is set

SetTreasury(address,address).details: Emitted when the Treasury contract is set

TokensClaimed(uint256,address,address,ui.details: Emitted when tokens are claimed by investors

params._to: Address to send the claimed tokens

params._amountToPurchase: Amount of IRO tokens to purchase

params._duration: Duration of the IRO in seconds
params._operationFee: Operation fee in the IRO currency
params._unitPrice: Price per unit of IRO token in the IRO currency

params._currency: Currency used to precify the IRO tokens

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._amountToPurchase: Amount of IRO tokens to purchase

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setCurrency(address).details: Set a new base price token

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

__gap.details: This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain. See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps

_fundsWithdrawn.details: Points out whether funds have been withdrawn from IRO

_realEstateIdSet.details: Whether an ID has already been set in the RealEstateNFT contract for the IRO

claim(uint256,address).notice: Claim purchased tokens when IRO successful or     get back commit amount in base currency if IRO failed

expectedTotalSupply(uint256).notice: Get the total supply of an IRO, if successful

price(uint256,uint256).notice: Get the total price of a purchase

remainingTokens(uint256).notice: Get the amount of remaining IRO tokens

userAmountAndShare(uint256,address).notice: Get an user purchased amount and shares of an IRO

withdraw(uint256).notice: Withdraw and distribute funds from successful IROs

userdoc.notice: Used to run IROs, mint tokens to RealEstateNFT     and distribute funds
